name: Tomato Salad
history: Tomato Salad is a dish enjoyed worldwide, with variations found in many different cuisines. It typically consists of fresh tomatoes and various herbs and dressings, reflecting the simplicity and versatility of the tomato as an ingredient.
description: Tomato Salad is a refreshing and light dish made with ripe tomatoes, fresh herbs, olive oil, and vinegar or lemon juice. It's a simple yet flavorful salad, often seasoned with salt, pepper, and other spices.

instructions.title: Prepare the Ingredients
instructions.description: Slice or chop the tomatoes and thinly slice the red onion. Chop the basil leaves.

instructions.title: Combine Salad Ingredients
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the tomatoes, red onion, and basil.

instructions.title: Dress the Salad
instructions.description: Drizzle the olive oil and balsamic vinegar or lemon juice over the salad. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.

instructions.title: Toss and Serve
instructions.description: Toss the salad gently to combine. Serve immediately for the freshest taste.

tips: Use ripe and juicy tomatoes for the best flavor.
Adjust the amount of vinegar or lemon juice according to your taste.
variations: Add cucumber or avocado for extra texture.
Sprinkle with feta cheese or olives for a Mediterranean twist.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Can be refrigerated for a few hours.
storage.instructions: If storing, cover and refrigerate. Best eaten the same day.

presentationTips: Serve in a colorful salad bowl to enhance the visual appeal.
Garnish with additional basil leaves or edible flowers.
